Print This Page
Cambridge City
MA

Resolution
RES 2024 #248
Order Adopted
Oct 21, 2024 5:30 PM

Condolences to the family of Paulette D. Jarvis.

Information

Department:City Clerk's Office, DSSponsors:Mayor E. Denise Simmons
Category:Death Resolution

Attachments

Version History
  1. Printout

Body

WHEREAS:

The City Council was deeply saddened to learn of the passing of Paulette D. Jarvis October 8, 2024 at the age of 85; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

Paulette D. Jarvis was born to the late Paul D. Smith and Thelma P. Smith on November 4, 1938, and from an early age she demonstrated a path destined for service, expressing a desire to become a missionary at age 11, which led her to travel with the elders and stay close to her mother; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

Paulette D. Jarvis attended Cambridge High & Latin School through the 12th grade and entered the workforce at Hood Rubber, where she displayed her ingenuity and creativity by contributing to advancements in production via designing an assembly tool that was patented by the company without compensation; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

Paulette D. Jarvis embodied an entrepreneurial spirit, founding the "Slush n Stuff" Truck & Store in Cambridge and designing her own line of custom handmade bags, hats, and jewelry under the name "Deep Spirit Originals"; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

Paulette D. Jarvis was also known for her expertise in antiques and collectibles, a passion that she loved to share with others, all while being devoted to her family and leaving behind a lasting legacy; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

Paulette D. Jarvis was preceded in death by her husband, Eugene Jarvis, her daughter, Lisa Jarvis, and three of her five siblings, Paul Smith, Pamela Curtis, and Esther Mitchell, she leaves behind her two remaining siblings, Patricia Ann Lucas and Pauline Smith, as well as her eight children: Nannette (Thelma), Eugene, Jay, Donna, Peter (Abdul Wali), Craig, Jadi (John), and Michael, by her sons-in-law, Maxo and Al, and her daughter-in-law, Rahima (Renee), by 21 grandchildren: Shandra, Martial, Aaron, Ahnauncia, Marlene, Joy, Shaleah, Jamaria, Jaden, Jeremiah, Raijan, Nia, Tessa, Stephon, Andre, Christopher, Staisha, Stacy, Keturah, Zahirah, and Naâ€™im, by her 13 great-grandchildren, many nieces, nephews, cousins, and countless friends, all of whom shall forever cherish her memory; now therefore be it

 

 

RESOLVED:

That the City Council go on record extending its deepest condolences to the family of Paulette D. Jarvis for their tremendous loss; and be it further

 

 

RESOLVED:

That the City Clerk be and hereby is requested to forward a suitably engrossed copy of this resolution to the Jarvis family on behalf of the entire City Council.

 

Meeting History

Oct 21, 2024 5:30 PM  City Council Regular Meeting
 Draft
RESULT:ORDER ADOPTED [UNANIMOUS]
YEAS:Burhan Azeem, Marc C. McGovern, Patricia Nolan, Sumbul Siddiqui, Jivan Sobrinho-Wheeler, Paul F. Toner, Ayesha M. Wilson, Catherine Zusy, E. Denise Simmons
